page.title: 12REDCAR TARN cont.
page.content: Nowadays,the tarn is used for a variety of recreational activities.In Summer it is very busy at the weekends as children are able to paddle,swim or take dinghies into the water.Fishing is another popular pastime all year round and model speedboat races are held once or twice a year.An annual raft race is held on the tarn,when opposing teams,starting from either end of the tarn try to push each other into the water! In Winter,when the tarn freezes over,it is ideal for ice-skating.The conversion of Redcar Tarn from a boggy swamp to a lake was,in fact due to the work of Keighley Skating Club established in 1865.Founder members included a future Mayor and M.P. for Keighley,members of the Brigg family. .
